No need to book, just drop in.   Just like a regular high-street coffee shop, Café Clare offers a warm place to meet and connect with other local people in the beautiful setting of your local hospice. Catch up with friends, make new ones, in our open and spacious Dining Room. Free buttered toast, tea and coffee available to all. No need to book, just drop in. properties.description: Supporting Young People We can't run our usual after school sessions during the national lockdown but we can still meet up remotely. Online after school social space is every Thursday at 3:30pm for a half hour catch up and chat. Invitations and links are going out to our regulars and there will be an opportunity for new people to join in the next couple of weeks. ​ The Box Counselling Service continues to offer online and telephone support and referrals can be made using the forms on our counselling page.
properties.title: The Box Epping

properties.description: Streets2Homes is a charity based in Harlow, Essex and we provide a day centre which seeks to reach out to and help homeless people. We provide a safe and friendly environment in which we can assist them in a number of ways including finding accommodation. The demand for housing in this area always outstrips availability so it can take time to find suitable accommodation and we are always looking for good landlords to work with us. The day centre provides a place to access housing advice and practical assistance to secure accommodation, social contact, training sessions, employment advice, health services, washing facilities, food, clothing, general guidance and support. Outreach Our outreach workers respond to reports of rough sleepers by going out on the streets and meeting with them. Inform them of services available, encourage them to come to the centre. Sometimes it takes time to build trust and confidence so this can take several visits until they are ready to come into the centre. We also carry out joint outreach with other agencies such as; DWP to ensure a rough sleeper is getting the benefits they are entitled to and not having to beg for money and food; drug and alcohol treatment teams and mental health teams to engage with rough sleepers and help them access services so they can get help to stay well and safe. We will ensure they have food, water, clothes and warm dry bedding until they are ready to access services. Day Centre Services The day centre provides a safe and friendly environment. We also have showers, clean clothes, refreshments, breakfast, healthy freshly cooked meal, assistance to claim benefits, seek accommodation, training and volunteering opportunities to enhance employability and confidence and life skills. We facilitate several workshop sessions to help with knowledge, confidence and well-being such as an art project, cooking skills, job club, computer club and the opportunity to complete accredited courses. Volunteering at the centre also enables our clients to help shape the services and provide insight to help us plan future projects. Help to seek and secure accommodation We have experienced staff to help find solutions to relieve or prevent homelessness, we have links with many local landlords in the private rented sector and can help remove barriers to securing accommodation through one of our deposit schemes. We also run a weekly tenancy workshop to help people who are struggling with their accommodation or who are seeking alternative accommodation. We hold regular multi-agency meetings with relevant partners to explore options, source suitable accommodation and develop support plans. Prevention of Homelessness The earliest someone is aware they are at risk of losing their accommodation and are at risk of becoming homeless the better, as prevention is far better than cure. We can liaise with the landlord and other agencies, provide mediation, work out repayments for arrears, provide support and assistance to ensure the tenant can stay in property. Warm Space Streets2Homes Day Room is open Monday to Friday 9am to 2pm for a warm welcome as well as teas and coffees for a 50p donation (no fee for homeless). You can find contact details on the Streets2Homes website.
properties.title: Streets2Homes

properties.title: Brentwood CVS

properties.description: Excelcare has announced today that a selection of their care homes in Essex will be opening ‘warm banks’ for people over the age of 65. These warm banks will be free to attend and offer a safe haven for people to seek warmth and relaxation when in need. Excelcare is a family run care provider with homes located across London, Essex, Cambridge and Milton Keynes. Providing person centred care since 1989, this award-winning provider has been at the forefront of the care sector for over 30 years. With the current cost of living crisis crippling families across the UK and the temperature steadily dropping as we approach winter, Excelcare has launched their warm bank initiative to provide support to an age group that are most likely to feel the harsh effects of the cold and rising energy costs. From 11am-4pm, people aged 65 and over will be welcomed into Excelcare homes listed in the graphic to seek refuge from the cold and enjoy a hot drink. The warm banks in each home are situated in communal areas such as lounges and dining rooms, so guests will also have the opportunity to engage with people who live and work in them. This will provide some welcomed company to elderly members of the community, especially those who live on their own or struggle with feelings of loneliness. Precautions are in place to ensure those who currently live and work in the homes remain safe and free from the spread of infection, so upon entry guests will be asked to sanitise their hands, complete a lateral flow test* and wear a face mask for the duration of their visit. Helen Bennett, Regional Operations Director of Excelcare homes in Essex said, “it’s a pleasure to announce the opening of our warm banks in care homes across the region. Providing a safe space for people who are in need this winter is something we have been committed to doing and I am so happy to see this initiative come to life. “I encourage people over the age of 65 to make use of these warm banks and seek refuge in our comfortable homes surrounded by our caring teams.” Warm banks in each of the homes participating will be opening today and closing on March 31st, 2023.
properties.title: Excelcare

properties.description: We believe that everyone can benefit from our services and we strive to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere that supports your personal journey to better health.   About Us The Butterfly effect wellbeing Journey Butterfly effect wellbeing was founded in 2019, by myself and my mum Chris. Mum had suffered for many years from mental ill health and found it hard to interact with people, so we come up with the idea of offering a safe space.   Butterfly Effect Wellbeing are providing a warm space at Paringdon Sports Club (CM19 4SG) 11am to 1pm every Tuesday and Friday and every other Sunday 11.30am to 1pm. Drinks and snacks are also provided. You can find contact details on the Butterfly Effect Wellbeing Facebook page.   The Butterfly Effect WELLbeing CIC at the Latton Bush Centre will be open Tuesdays and Fridays from 11am to 2.30pm.
properties.title: Butterfly Effect WELLbeing

Clubs and classes using the hall include for children; theatre group, ballet and football. Adult clubs and classes include pilates, yoga, WD50 [ exercise for the elderly and less mobile ], essex sheddies group, vintage bike club, U3A, bridge club, warm room with swapping library, games and activities, refreshments. The catchment area is Fyfield, Willingale, Morton, Chipping Ongar, The hall is available to hire as one large hall, or two smaller with sound proof divider, or a clubroom with bar.

properties.description: Sumners Farm Close (Independent Living) Scheme is a two-story flat block situated in the Sumners and Kingsmoor area of Harlow, consisting of 42 self-contained one bedroom flats. Sumners Farm Close provides additional services for tenants to enable them to continue to live independently, such as a midday meals service and a 24 hour on-site care provider. The carer supports planned care for individual tenants as well as unplanned care in the event of an emergency or sudden illness.

properties.description: Tuesday 10am to 4pm Refreshments – free bowl of soup and hot buttered toast between 12 noon and 2pm Activities – jigsaws / knitting / adult colouring / lending library / community pantry Wifi available   The Noah’s Ark Community Hub is a community focussed charity who through social action, support and care wish to enhance the Buckhurst Hill residents life experience. Through action, support and care our aim is to initiate activities and services for the people of Buckhurst hill and surrounding areas, to form a cohesive society with a community feel where we take care of one another. We wish to explore the needs of families, children and those older in years, so that we can take action to support them and care for their needs wherever they are. We are just getting started and have moved to additional premises where we can really kick things off! We have many community activities and outreach initiatives planned, with a team of staff, trustees and volunteers ready to make things happen. Now it a great time to climb aboard the Ark as we launch our clubs, groups and services which will benefit our local community.
properties.title: Noah’s Ark Community Hub

properties.description: The Leah Manning Centre provides specialist day care for older people with a warm and friendly atmosphere. The centre is named after a former teacher and MP for Epping in the 1930s and 1940s. We run the centre in partnership with Essex County Council Adult Social Care, which funds the specialist day care. Our highly skilled staff provide person-centred support and individual care plans.   Activities The Leah Manning Centre is an ideal environment to make friends and socialise with others. Every day at the centre is different, with a variety of stimulating activities and opportunities on offer for older adults with a range of support needs. Our activities are designed to maximise independence and maintain skills for everyday living, helping our users to be part of their local community and meet new people. Everyone is offered choice and control over the activities they want to participate in. Example activities: arts and crafts cinema afternoons quizzes mobile library physical games reminiscence through pictures and music singalongs and music Monthly outings bingo and raffles board games sensory and therapeutic activities Accessing our service If you are interested in attending our centre there are two routes you could take: self-referral referral from Essex County Council Social Services Self-referral If you opt for self-referral, you can contact the Leah Manning Centre for more information on charges and availability. We have a range of packages available to suit your individual needs and requirements. Packages can include: full day attendance transport to and from your home hot two-course lunch For a self referral, you need to contact us: email: leah.manning@harlow.gov.uk or call 01279 446121. Referral from Essex County Council If you would like a referral from Essex County Council Social Services, they will assess your requirements for care and support. This can be either through their in-house teams or by setting you a personal budget to pay for your visits to the centre. Direct payments are welcome. You can contact Essex County Council Social Services on 0345 603 7630   Volunteering We have volunteering opportunities at The Leah Manning Centre - contact the centre for information on the current opportunities.
properties.title: The Leah Manning Centre

properties.description: Held at Chigwell Parish Community Hub ( next door to Victory Hall), Hainult, Road, Chigwell, IG7 6QZ. Tea Rooms Every Tuesday 10am- 2pm. There is a small charge for tea and cake. Social and warm space Every Thursday 10am-3pm. Free. You can get lunch too. Bereavement café Second Friday of every month 13.30- 15.00. Free. The hub is a lovely space to see service users   Open on the following days and times:   Tuesday - 10am to 2pm Thursday - 10am to 3pm Friday - See below List of Activities Tuesdays My Weight Matters - 12pm to 1pm (free of charge) Tea Rooms - 10am to 2pm (there is a small charge for tea and cake) Bridge - 10am to 12pm Chigwell Community Pantry - 10am to 1:30pm Epping Forest Affordable Counselling (see More Information below) Thursdays 1st Thursday of the Month - Quiz Time 2nd Thursday of the Month - Bingo Fun Time 3rd Thursday of the Month - Crafts Day (there is a small charge of £3 to £5 to cover the cost of materials) 4th Thursday of the Month - Escape Room Puzzle Time Chigwell Community Pantry - 10am to 2:30pm Epping Forest Affordable Counselling (see More Information below) Social Spaces / Warm Places - 10am to 3pm Fridays 2nd Friday of the Month - Bereavement Cafe - 1:30pm to 3pm Last Friday of the Month - Memory Cafe - 11am to 1pm (see More Information below) More Information Chigwell Community Pantry The Chigwell Community Pantry is open between 10am and 1:30pm on Tuesdays, and 10am and 2:30pm on Thursdays, for people who are struggling with the daily cost of living crisis. For a £5 donation you can purchase up to 20 items of household goods and food (including pet food). There is no need to book - just walk in. There is no criteria or judgement. Epping Forest Affordable Counselling For further information please contact: affordablecounsellingef@gmail.com or call 07583 111796. This service is self-referral and there is a minimum charge of £5. Bereavement Café A safe place to talk and connect with people who understand. Do you feel like you are struggling to come to terms with a loss and would like some support? Join us for tea, cake and conversation. If you are experiencing grief and loss and would like to connect with others, or to speak with one of our trained team, come along to our drop-in Bereavement Café. When: The second Friday of the month - 1:30pm to 3pm Memory Café A safe space to connect with others who share similar experiences and giving carers an opportunity to chat with one of our lived-experience support team. For further information please contact: 07853 944829 or visit www.limesfarmcg.co.uk When: The last Friday of the month - 11am to 1pm We look forward to seeing you!
